comment: Worst anthropology class I've ever taken. As someone paying tuition, I feel scammed ... I'm not even exaggerating.
DON'T DO IT. She does not grade work throughout the semester. Grades are due May 9th, it is currently May 2nd and ZERO grades are in. Beware, she is a pain to get ahold of too.

Professor Torres is very interesting. I have never had a professor with such ambiguous grading criteria. We have an essay coming up and she requests it be in 11-point, Times New Roman font, double-spaced.  She is not clear on what she wants and she releases content by the week so you cannot look ahead to see if you have a project due.

Do not take this teacher. She is hard to communicate with and get any responses back. She does not do any of own lectures, just throws a whole bunch of videos at you and basically, you teach yourself. She doesn't grade anything until the last few weeks of class. Work is sort of easy, but kind of confusing.

Professor Torres was not a very good professor. I am convinced that she made us grade our own work with "peer review" assignments because she did not want to grade them. There was one for almost every assignment. Very time consuming for practically no reason.

Prof Torres is a great person and very knowledgeable on her field, but I am not the biggest fan of her instructional method. She's also not very organized when it comes to entering grades on D2L, so there's absolutely no way to track your progress during the semester. I would not recommend if you really care about Anthropology and want to learn.
Professor Torres is very nice and understanding, but not the greatest instructor. Although the subject material is very interesting, she tends to make it very dull and slow-paced.

Honestly she just seemed busy trying to finish her dissertation. Never answered my emails. Did work with me on making up work I had missed (and didn't even require I give an explanation). Class is mostly group discussions and group projects.

Took this class once a week for 2 hours and 45 minutes. Very slow and could get boring. The material was interesting. Assigned challenges that needed to be completed outside of class to engage the class more. There was a final project at the end along with a final. Boring and would not take this prof again.

She's a terrible professor. She assigns homework over the weekends and breaks. She never answers emails. It's the end of the semester, and I only have 2 assignment grades while others are blank. It's sad she is the only professor who teaches linguistics.

Professor Torres cares a lot about her students and always tries to give them the benefit of the doubt. She is very flexible and will work with students if a due date needs to be changed. I think the work is pretty easy, but I had a decent amount of background from other classes. Don't have to read, but you do have to participate weekly.

This is by far the WORST professor I have ever taken. An online course & she has NEVER posted a single lecture. She only posts random YouTube videos which I could watch for free without paying tuition. By far the laziest way you could possibly teach a class. Final project is a PowerPoint w/video, something she doesn't even bother taking time to do.

Professor Torres is such a gem! I can't say enough great things about her and her ability to provide incredible material and lessons for her students. There's not a lot of caring professors, but she's one!

This semester I took all easy gen Ed classes, so this courses heavy workload didnt bother me that much and gave me something to do. People complain about her assignments, but theyre really not that hard. Quiz answers are on quizlet. The challenges can be time consuming, again who cares. Take this class only if your other classes arent demanding
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read--Group projects

comment: Has absolutely no idea how to teach, only tells students to read various outside sources with no commentary, requires students use personal social media for class, and assigns large projects with extremely short due dates.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read--Tough grader

comment: Overkill for a 1000-level course, do not take!
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read--Participation matters

comment: You will read and write a lot. The professor was used to teaching this course in person so a lot of the assignments and just the class, in general, was a little unorganized and confusing, but she was always happy to help clarify and explain things. She really cares about you and your grade.

The professor is really kind and is always open to suggestions. She did struggle with the new online format a bit so the course assignment and just different things were confusing and unorganized, but she was always happy to help and clarify if you reached out. You will read and write A LOT.

This class is discussion post heavy. We have a discussion every week over the reading in the textbook. Also, there is a quiz every 2 weeks or so and they're super easy, no lock down browser. As for the professor, she's really disorganized, doesn't answer emails fast enough, and posts assignments late. Despite that, the class is really easy.

This class is an easy A if you do the assignments. Big midterm Paper. Big final paper, other than that the assignments are short and easy. She doesn't lecture, its a discussion class. She can be difficult to email with, and takes FOREVER to grade things. I didn't do any of the readings, but I went to every class.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--SO MANY PAPERS--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: Easy class but this professor is honestly a mess. she's nice but her grading criteria and assignments are all over the place. She doesn't lecture, but assigns 100pgs to read and then start class with "what did you think of it" not actually explaining what we read. I regret taking her class. I learned nothing. She shouldn't teach upper level classes
rating_tags: Get ready to read--GRADED BY FEW THINGS--EXTRA CREDIT
